Home.title: Nina Mae Louw
Home.intro: I am a full stack developer and designer. I am passionate about creating intuitive user experiences and have the skills to build them: from user research, prototyping,and usability testing to building and deploying full stack applications.

section1.title: English Literature & Arts
section1.para: I have a Bachelor’s degree in English Literature, Philosophy and Art History, and a Masters degreee in English Literature from Oxford University. I have highly-developed language and research skills and am a specialist in analyzing large amounts of qualitative data.

section2.title: Programming & Design
section2.para: My coding journey is a mixture of self-teaching online, Udacity’s Front-End Nanodegree, Codecore Web Developer Bootcamp and Web Design and Development at Vanarts. I now have experience with Ruby, Rails, Javascript, jQuery, HTML & CSS, relational databases and testing, and building full stack web apps.I have honed my full stack Javascript skills by learning React, Redux, Vue.js and Express.js. I have studied UX design and interface design principles, and have experience designing interactive prototypes and using the Adobe CC suite, Sketch and Invision.

section3.title: Full Stack developer
section3.para: I currently work as a full stack Ruby and Javascript developer - taking on responsibilities from upgrading our SASS to Bootstrap 4, improving our sign up flow and use of routing APIs, and testing with Selenium and Capybara - to redesigning internal UI interfaces.

section1.title: Research & Strategy
section1.para: I have experience doing graduate-level research and am passionate about user research and user-centred design. I am a convincing and detail-oriented content creator -  I have worked as a copywriter and a freelance photojournalist.

section2.title: Design
section2.para: I have technical experience with Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign, After Effects and Premier, creating mockups with Sketch and creating prototypes with Invision and Adobe XD. I am passionate about user-centred design and enjoy user research, usability testing and designing apps with the user in mind.

section3.title: Front End
section3.para: I have experience with HTML5, CSS3, SASS, Javascript, jQuery, AJAX, React, Redux, Angular.js and Vue.js, testing with Jasmine, Mocha and Jest, and compiling builds with Grunt, Gulp and Webpack. I am interested in using front-end frameworks to create a more intuitive and reassuring experience for the user. I have recent experience redesigning sign up flows to create a simpler, frictionless sign up process.

section4.title: Back End
section4.para: I have experience with Ruby, PHP, Rails, Laravel, Express.js, Node.js, Postgres, mySQL, MongoDB, Heroku, AWS, Digital Ocean, Redis and testing with Rspec, Cabybara, Selenium and Sauce labs. I am currently tackling refactoring fat models in a Rails codebase and hope to grow towards writing service-oriented code that tries to simplify the behaviour of features.

proj1.title: Pooch Pals
proj1.para: My own business endeavour which allows Vancouverites to borrow local dogs for walks. I have designed and built the MVP using Rails and React, and am currently running user testing studies and marketing my product.

proj2.title: Mealkit Prototype
proj2.para: An interactive prototype for a meal kit delivery company that focuses on simplifying weekly recipe choices and providing the user with delivery updates. The prototype displays the first two primary tasks decided on after doing user research, creating task models, and running usability tests. Created with Sketch and Invision.

proj3.title: HellKitty Studios
proj3.para: Web application created for client comic artists Pia Guerra and Ian Boothby. The web app allows them to update content on their landing page, as well as updating content in their respective galleries and profiles. Built using Rails, AJAX, jQuery, Postgresql and Bootstrap.

proj4.title: Vote Up
proj4.para: Group project at Vancouver Institute of Media Arts - we were tasked to build a website to increase voter awareness amongst the Candian youth. The web app includes map-based search of country-wide MPs, and a voting on policies poitical leanings test. Built with SASS, Jade, Javascript, jQuery and Gulp.

proj5.title: Full Circle Goals
proj5.para: A goal-tracking app that allows you to set yourself a goal routine. It includes a visualization of your daily goals and a consecutive days completed progress bar. The app will allow a user to visualize and effectively keep to the goals that he or she has set. The app uses a Rails API, React.js, AJAX, JavaScript, HTML, CSS, Materialize-UI and PostgreSQL.

proj6.title: Food Finder
proj6.para: Food Explorer is a SAP created for the Udacity FEND course that uses Knockout.js and a MVVM pattern for the app architecture and a responsive UI. It uses Google Maps API and Foursquare API for the map functionality and to allow users to search for keywords and receive helpful food-related data about places in Vancouver.
